snippet: Jurors in the bribery trial of Malcolm A. Smith are being polled to find out if they can serve longer while the defense team translates 28 hours of Yiddish conversations.
abstract: Mistrial in federal government's bribery case against New York State Sen Malcolm A Smith and two other defendants seems highly possible; Judge Kenneth M Karas says he will ask jurors whether they can serve into mid-July so defense lawyers can digest dozens of hours of recorded conversation in Yiddish and English.
lead_paragraph: Jurors in the bribery trial of Malcolm A. Smith are being polled to find out if they can serve longer while the defense team translates 28 hours of Yiddish conversations.
